text:
Problem 3.2

Using Prime Factorization with Exponents

Prime numbers have an interesting multiplicative structure. The only factors of a prime number are the number and 1. The longest possible factor string for any number is made up of primer numbers. This string is the prime factorization. The prime factorization of 840 is the factorization that is decomposed into the primes 2, 3, 5, and 7.
